intro: Peucedanum wallichianum, commonly known as Himalayan cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
